intro: Paspalidium punctatum var. longiglume, commonly known as the longglume paspalum, is a grass species native to the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with颖 (glumes) that are longer than the lemma, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in wetland and marshy habitats, often forming dense mats. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems and a subject of study in ecological and taxonomic research.
